history.content:
I took W186 last semester (Fall 2021) and time conflicts were allowed. Lecture videos were released at the beginning of the week (pre-recorded). Discussions had both in person and online zoom offerings (with recordings posted at the end of the week), and alternate exam times were offered (I used one due to a MT conflict with 170 (it was online) but not sure how lenient alternate finals were).

Aside from lectures, it was more beneficial imo to be in person because some things like review sessions were only provided in person, and OH was better as well.

I'd take a look at the policies from fa21: https://cs186berkeley.net/fa21/syllabus/

I took W186 last semester (Fall 2021) and time conflicts were allowed. Lecture videos were released at the beginning of the week (pre-recorded). Discussions had both in person and online zoom offerings (with recordings posted at the end of the week), and alternate exam times were offered (I used one due to a MT conflict with 170 but not sure how lenient alternate finals were. 170 and 186 finals were 30 min apart last semester but that was just what you had to deal with haha).

Aside from lectures, it was more beneficial imo to be in person because some things like review sessions were only provided in person, and OH was better as well.

I'd take a look at the policies from fa21: https://cs186berkeley.net/fa21/syllabus/

Has anyone taken CS 186 (web-based)? Can anyone share how the lectures, discussions, and exams were given? Do they provide alternative final exam time slots? I have another class that has a time conflict with CS W186, so I want to check if I can deal with these. Thanks!
history.subject: CS W186 schedule
